message_1: Find all the quadratic residues modulo 17.
message_2:
A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. To find all the quadratic residues modulo 17, we need to compute the squares of the numbers from 0 to 16 (since 17 is a prime number) and then reduce them modulo 17.

0² ≡ 0 (mod 17)
1² ≡ 1 (mod 17)
2² ≡ 4 (mod 17)
3² ≡ 9 (mod 17)
4² ≡ 16 (mod 17)
5² ≡ 25 ≡ 8 (mod 17)
6² ≡ 36 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
7² ≡ 49 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
8² ≡ 64 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
9² ≡ 81 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
10² ≡ 100 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
11² ≡ 121 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
12² ≡ 144 ≡ 8 (mod 17)
13² ≡ 169 ≡ 16 (mod 17)
14² ≡ 196 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
15² ≡ 225 ≡ 4 (mod 17)
16² ≡ 256 ≡ 1 (mod 17)

Now, we can list the distinct quadratic residues modulo 17:

{0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 13, 15, 16}
